metadata.title: CVE-2020-10289 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Use of unsafe yaml load. Allows instantiation of arbitrary objects. Theflaw itself is caused by an unsafe parsing of YAML values which happenswhenever an action message is processed to be sent, and allows for thecreation of Python objects. Through this flaw in the ROS core package ofactionlib, an attacker with local or remote access can make the ROS Master,execute arbitrary code in Python form. Consider yaml.safe_load() instead.Located first in actionlib/tools/library.py:132. See links for more info onthe bug.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10289` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cl-actionlib - 1.13.1-4
libactionlib1d - 1.13.1-4
python3-actionlib - 1.13.1-4
python3-actionlib-tools - 1.13.1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ros-actionlib package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-4').
